Package tools.io

Class BlockBufferInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • tools.io.BlockBufferInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public abstract class BlockBufferInputStream
extends java.io.InputStream
    Abstract class for making an InputStream which accepts only (dynamic) chunks of data instead of a stream.

      • getNextBlockSize

        protected abstract int getNextBlockSize()
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the block size for the readBlock(byte[]) function.
        This function will be called exactly once before each call to the readBlock(byte[]) function.
        Furthermore is guarateed that this function will only be called after the readBlock(byte[]) function has been invoked for the previous block (if such a block exists).
        Returns:
        The next block size.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs.

      • readBlock

        public abstract int readBlock​(byte[] b)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a block from the underlying input stream.
        The block must be written into the provided byte array b, and is filled from low index to high index.
        If there are is less data in the stream than the array size, the first part of the array is filled and the second part remains unchanged.
        Parameters:
        b - The array to write the data to. It is filled from low to high index.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written to b.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs.
